title: Growth & Change
description: Discover how your attachment style has evolved through this relationship.

questions.text: How has my attachment security changed since being with you?
choices: I feel significantly more secure
I'm slowly becoming more secure
It fluctuates based on how we're doing
I've always felt fairly secure

therapeutic.rationale: Security change reflects relationship impact. Significantly-more-secure shows earned security; slow-growth shows gradual healing; fluctuation shows dependent security; always-secure shows baseline stability. Healthy relationships can shift attachment from insecure to earned secure.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different security change reflects different starting points and trajectories. The significant-changer celebrates healing; the always-secure may not understand the journey. Honor where each is.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared security change means similar growth. You're both being healed by this relationship in similar ways.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How has your attachment security changed? What specific moments or patterns created that change? What would increase security further?

questions.text: What's the biggest attachment shift I've made in this relationship?
choices: Trusting that someone won't leave
Allowing myself to depend on someone
Being comfortable with closeness
Expressing needs without fear

therapeutic.rationale: Biggest attachment shifts reveal healed wounds. Trust-in-staying heals abandonment; dependency-allowing heals avoidance; closeness-comfort heals engulfment fear; need-expressing heals suppression. Celebrating your biggest shift acknowledges real growth.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different biggest shifts celebrate different healing. Each of you is being healed in unique ways by this relationship. Honor each other's specific growth.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared biggest shifts mean similar healing. This relationship is healing similar wounds in both of you.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your biggest attachment shift? What made this shift possible? What shift do you still want to make?

questions.text: What old pattern am I actively working to change?
choices: Seeking too much reassurance
Pulling away when things get close
Testing your commitment
Hiding my true feelings

therapeutic.rationale: Pattern-change work shows active attachment growth. Reassurance-reducing addresses anxious patterns; pull-away work addresses avoidance; test-stopping addresses manipulation; feeling-showing addresses suppression. Active work on patterns is the path to earned security.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different pattern work means supporting different growth. Encourage your partner's specific work even when different from yours.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared pattern work can be done together. You understand each other's challenge because you share it.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What old pattern are you working on? What helps you change it? What support do you need?

questions.text: What helps me grow into more secure attachment?
choices: Your consistent, predictable love
Safe experiences that contradict my fears
Space to process and understand myself
Your patience with my healing journey

therapeutic.rationale: Growth support reveals healing pathways. Consistent-love builds trust over time; safe-contradiction creates new neural pathways; processing-space allows integration; patience-with-healing gives time. Understanding what helps your partner grow helps you actively support their healing.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different growth support guides how to help each other. The consistent-love needer needs reliability; the processing-space needer needs room. Provide what your partner needs.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared growth support makes helping easy. You know what helps because it's what would help you.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What helps you grow toward more secure attachment? Is this happening in your relationship? What would accelerate your growth?

choices: To feel secure even when apart
To allow deep closeness without fear
To trust without needing constant proof
To express needs clearly and directly

therapeutic.rationale: Attachment growth goals reveal your path to security. Secure-when-apart addresses anxious attachment; closeness-without-fear addresses avoidant attachment; trust-without-proof addresses testing patterns; clear-need-expression addresses suppression. Naming your goal directs your growth energy.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different growth goals show different journeys. Support your partner's specific goal even when yours differs.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared growth goals mean aligned journeys. You're working toward similar security. Support each other's progress.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your attachment growth goal? What would achieving it look like? What's one step you could take toward it?
